item.title: About
item.description: Mirza Waleed ðŸ™‚ PhD student in Geography at the Department of Geography, Hong Kong Baptist University, Hong Kong (SAR). My research interest includes: Geographic Information Science (GIS), Remote Sensing, and Environmental Modeling. More specifically, I am interested in applying geospatial techniques, machine learning, and cloud computing (e.g., Google Earth Engine) in Hazards-Risk assessment, Environmental Change Monitoring, Floods Mapping & Automation, Land-use science, UTFVI (Urban Heat Island effect), and climate change.

item.title: Publications
item.description: Current Working Papers Earth observation for Flood Risk Assessment (Ongoing - 2022) Multi-Temporal Resilience Evaluation in Pakistan (Ongoing - 2022) Warming Cities in Pakistan: Evaluating Spatial-temporal Dynamics of Urban Thermal Field Variance Index under Rapid Urbanization (Ongoing - 2022) Submitted Papers Exploring and Predicting Thermal Field Variance in Response to Urban Growth: A Geo-information Modelling-based Spatial-temporal Assessment in the Context of Sustainable and Livable Cities (Submitted as First Author, 2022 - Egyptian Journal of Remote Sensing & Space Science)
